docs.snippet: LEAD: The United States Open has been very good to Mark Woodforde of Australia. He made it through the qualifying rounds, now spends every other day advancing through the main draw, enjoys a few giggles during mixed doubles play, and occasionally has...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The United States Open has been very good to Mark Woodforde of Australia. He made it through the qualifying rounds, now spends every other day advancing through the main draw, enjoys a few giggles during mixed doubles play, and occasionally has an opportunity to practice against Steffi Graf of West

docs.snippet: LEAD: They encounter each other at 7 A.M. staff meetings or 7 P.M. official dinner parties and have had late-night dates at such romantic venues as the Republican convention and international conferences on tariffs and trade.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The $790 million proposed by the Reagan Administration to combat AIDS in the fiscal year 1988 will not cover the costs of needed research, education and testing, scientists and health workers said today.

headline.main: Reagan's AIDS Battle Assailed as Inadequate

docs.snippet: LEAD: Foreign Minister Eduard A. Shevardnadze arrived here today on a regional tour intended to expand the Soviet Union's presence in Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Foreign Minister Eduard A. Shevardnadze arrived here today on a regional tour intended to expand the Soviet Union's presence in Latin America.

headline.main: Shevardnadze Off to Rio to Start Latin Tour

byline.original: By MARLISE SIMONS, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: A sense of hopelessness appears to pervade a huge gathering here of the top economic officials of nearly every nation on earth as they search for some way out of the bind of poor-country debt that has been draining the economies of most nations...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A sense of hopelessness appears to pervade a huge gathering here of the top economic officials of nearly every nation on earth as they search for some way out of the bind of poor-country debt that has been draining the economies of most nations for five years.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Soviet Foreign Minister, on a tour of Latin America, has assured his hosts that Moscow strongly supports the new Central American peace plan and will put no obstacles in its way, Brazilian officials said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Soviet Foreign Minister, on a tour of Latin America, has assured his hosts that Moscow strongly supports the new Central American peace plan and will put no obstacles in its way, Brazilian officials said today.

headline.main: Shevardnadze, in Brazil, Backs Latin Peace Plan

byline.original: By MARLISE SIMONS, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Sir Geoffrey H. S. Jackson, the British diplomat who spent eight months in a dungeon in 1971 after being kidnapped by Uruguayan guerrillas, died on Thursday, his family said today. He was 72 years old.

headline.main: Geoffrey Jackson, 72, Envoy Held 8 Months by Tupamaros

headline.main: Soviet Courts South America With an Eye for Trade

docs.snippet: LEAD: The world's stock markets continued to show strength in the sixth year of the bull market, although the pace of expansion slowed. In the quarter ending Sept. 30, stock prices worldwide rose by 5.7 percent, according to figures compiled by...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The world's stock markets continued to show strength in the sixth year of the bull market, although the pace of expansion slowed. In the quarter ending Sept. 30, stock prices worldwide rose by 5.7 percent, according to figures compiled by Morgan Stanley Capital International.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The United States and Canada have agreed to an extensive trade pact that would stimulate economic activity in both countries by eliminating tariffs and other trade barriers before the end of the century.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The United States and Canada have agreed to an extensive trade pact that would stimulate economic activity in both countries by eliminating tariffs and other trade barriers before the end of the century.

headline.main: TRADE PACT IS SEEN AS ECONOMIC SPUR BY U.S. AND CANADA
